title: Event policy
text: We consider any gathering of people, at our request, an event.

title: Event policy
text:
Rules

We will be running all our events virtually by default.
Local in-person events are permitted when a clear added value is documented.
Everywhere we can go in 8 hours with public transport is considered local.
In-person events only happen with the consent of attendees.
Hybrid events are organized as virtual first.
The event policy applies to both internal and external events







Note



For more detailed explanations, see our latest blog on our Event policy

title: Introduction
text:
Introduction
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.





References

title: Welcome to Liberate Science ü§©
text:
This is our joint handbook, where we collect all the resources needed to create a shared understanding of how we work.
How we work is continuously evolving, so we encourage suggested edits! On that note, also be sure to check back regularly to stay up to speed. This handbook is ours to co-create.

title: Summary
text:
Summary
In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.
